revision.comment: Misc citation tidying. You can [[WP:UCB|use this bot]] yourself. [[WP:DBUG|Report bugs here]]. | [[User:Josve05a|Josve05a]]
revision.text:
{{pp-protect|small=yes}} {{About|the actor|the professional wrestler|Sonjay Dutt}} {{Infobox person | name = Sanjay Dutt | image = Sanjay_Dutt_on_the_sets_of_Torbaaz.png | caption = Dutt on the sets of Torbaaz | imagesize = | parents = [[Sunil Dutt]]
[[Nargis]] | ethnicity = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1959|7|29}} | birth_place = [[Bombay State]], India | birth_name = Sanjay Balraj Dutt | other names = Sanju,Baba | occupation = Film actor, film producer, comedian, politician, television presenter | yearsactive = 1981– present | height = | spouse = {{marriage|[[Richa Sharma (actress)|Richa Sharma]]
|1987|1996|end=d.}}
{{marriage|[[Rhea Pillai]]
|1998|2008|end=div.}}{{cite web |url= http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/I-would-love-to-write-my-biography-Sanjay-Dutt/articleshow/11860665.cms |title= I would love to write my biography: Sanjay Dutt |publisher= [[The Times of India]] |date=13 February 2012 |accessdate= 2014-10-03}}
{{marriage|[[Manyata Dutt]]
|2008}} | children = 3 | relatives = See [[List of Hindi film clans#Dutt family (of Sunil Dutt)|Dutt family]] }} '''Sanjay Balraj Dutt''' ([[Urdu]]: سنجے دتّ, [[Hindi]]: संजय दत्त, born 29 July 1959) is an [[Indian film]] actor and producer known for his work in Hindi cinema ([[Bollywood]]). He was educated at [[The Lawrence School, Sanawar]]. The son of veteran Hindi film actors [[Sunil Dutt]] and [[Nargis Dutt]], he made his acting debut in 1981 and has since appeared in more than 187 [[Hindi film]]s. Although Dutt has enjoyed great success as a lead actor in genres ranging from romance to comedy, it has been the roles of gangsters, thugs and police officers in the drama and action genres that have won him much appreciation. The Indian media and audiences alike popularly refer to him as ''Deadly Dutt'' for his larger-than-life portrayals of such characters. In a film career spanning more than 37 years, Dutt has won two [[Filmfare Awards]], two [[IIFA Awards]], two [[Bollywood Movie Awards]], three [[Screen Awards]], three [[Stardust Awards]], two [[Zee Cine Awards]], and a [[Global Indian Film Awards|Global Indian Film Award]]. Four of his films have won various [[National Film Awards]]. He has won most of his awards for ''[[Vaastav: The Reality]]'', ''[[Mission Kashmir]]'', ''[[Munna Bhai MBBS]]'', and ''[[Lage Raho Munna Bhai]]''. He won three Best Actor awards for ''[[Vaastav: The Reality]]''. Dutt was arrested under the [[Terrorist and Disruptive Activities (Prevention) Act]] (TADA) in April 1993. Charges of terrorism were dropped but he was convicted of illegal possession of weapons. After serving his sentence with good behaviour and conduct, he was released on 25 February 2016. ==Personal life== [[File:SanjayDutt-ManyataDutt.jpg|thumb|240px|right|Dutt with wife Manyata Dutt in 2011]] Dutt was born to cinema actors [[Sunil Dutt]] and [[Nargis]]. He has two sisters, [[Priya Dutt]] and Namrata Dutt.{{cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/No-sister-gets-along-with-her-brothers-wife-Dutt/articleshow/3997120.cms|title=No sister gets along with her brother's wife: Dutt}}{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/namrata-dutt-sanju-sanjay-dutt-5256351/|title=Namrata Dutt reacts after watching Sanju: I didn’t connect with Paresh Rawal and Manisha Koirala}} He is a devout [[Hindu]] who has read holy scriptures and theological works.[http://www.deccanchronicle.com/amp/entertainment/bollywood/210316/sanjay-dutt-to-work-for-jail-reforms-1.html/ Personal Life Material] - Religious Views Source His mother died in 1981, shortly before his debut film's premiere; her death is cited as the instigator of his drug abuse.{{cite web|title=Sanjay Dutt used to Drugs|url=http://www.bollywoodmantra.com/news/sanjay-dutt-drug-addiction-jail-stints-and-failed-marriages/2214/|publisher=bollywoodmantra.com|accessdate=2013-08-22}} As a child actor, Dutt appeared in the 1972 film ''[[Reshma Aur Shera]]'', which starred his father; he appeared briefly as a qawali singer.{{cite web|author1=PTI|title=Sanjay Dutt to do a qawwali after 41 years in Zanjeer|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-others/sanjay-dutt-to-do-a-qawwali-after-41-years-in-zanjeer/|website=The Indian Express|accessdate=2016-05-17|date=2 September 2013}} Dutt married actress [[Richa Sharma (actress)|Richa Sharma]] in 1987.{{cite web|title=I have become a family man: Sanjay Dutt|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/61609/i-have-become-a-family-man-sanjay-dutt/|work=The Express Tribune|accessdate=2010-10-21}} She died of a brain tumour in 1996. The couple have a daughter, Trishala, born in 1988, who lives in the United States with her maternal grandparents.http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/dutt/20080704.htm Dutt's second marriage was to model [[Rhea Pillai]] in 1998.{{cite web |title=Life and loves of Sanjay Dutt he is a really fantastic |url=http://movies.ndtv.com/gallerydetails.aspx?category=movies&id=4387&picno=21§ion=bollywood&ShowID=0#BD |publisher=NDTV |accessdate=2010-10-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110714162044/http://movies.ndtv.com/gallerydetails.aspx?category=movies&id=4387&picno=21§ion=bollywood&ShowID=0#BD |archive-date=14 July 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} The divorce finalised in 2008. Dutt married [[Manyata Dutt|Manyata]] (born Dilnawaz Sheikh){{cite web|title=Unknown starlet Dilnawaz's journey to Mrs Manyata Dutt|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/unknown-starlet-dilnawazs-journey-to-mrs-manyata-dutt/83359-8.html|publisher=Ibnlive.in|accessdate=2010-10-21}} in 2008 in a private ceremony in [[Goa]], after two years of dating.{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt marries Manyata|url=http://in.reuters.com/article/idINIndia-31876920080211 |work=Reuters |accessdate=2010-10-21 |date=11 February 2008}} On 21 October 2010, he became a father to twins, a boy and a girl.{{cite news|title=Manyata Dutt delivers twins |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-10-21/news-interviews/28247462_1_manyata-dutt-twins-trishala|work=Times of India|accessdate=2010-10-21 |date=21 October 2010}} ==Film career== ===1981–1997=== Dutt made his [[Bollywood]] movie debut with the box office super hit ''[[Rocky (1981 film)|Rocky]]'' in 1981. Dutt then went on to star in ''[[Vidhaata]]'', the highest grossing Hindi film of 1982, along with movies like ''[[Main Awara Hoon]]'' (1983). In 1985 he shot for his first film in three years, ''Jaan ki Baazi'' (1985). ''Jaan ki Baazi'' marked a comeback for Dutt and he appeared in successful films throughout the 80s such as ''Imaandaar'', ''[[Inaam Dus Hazaar]]'', ''[[Jeete Hain Shaan Se]]'' (1988), ''[[Mardon Wali Baat]]'' (1988), ''[[Ilaaka]]'' (1989), ''[[Hum Bhi Insaan Hain (1989 film)|Hum Bhi Insaan Hain]]'' (1989), ''[[Kanoon Apna Apna]]'' (1989), and ''[[Taaqatwar]].''{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-others/sanjay-dutt-on-the-wrong-side-of-the-law/|title=Sanjay Dutt – On the wrong side of the law|date=16 May 2013|publisher=}} The 1986 blockbuster ''[[Naam (1986 film)|Naam]]'' was Dutt's first major critical success and a turning point in his career, the film firmly cemented him amongst India's finest young main stream leading actors as he earned praise for his portrayal of an illegal immigrant in Dubai who spirals into a life of crime.http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/44956266.cms?utm_source=contentofinterest&utm_medium=text&utm_campaign=cppsthttps://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/2000/12/08/stories/09080221.htmhttps://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-others/sanjay-dutt-on-the-wrong-side-of-the-law/ His performances in both ''[[Kabzaa]]'' (1988) and [[J. P. Dutta]]'s 1989 ''[[Hathyar (1989 film)|Hathyar]]'' were both well received by critics although both films only managed average collections at the box office.{{cite web|title=Sanjay received critical acclaim for Kabzaa|url=http://www.stargold.in/newsdetails.aspx?nid=4451|publisher=stargold.in|accessdate=2013-08-22}}{{cite web|title=Sanjay received critical acclaim for Kabzaa And Hathyar|url=http://movies.addatoday.com/2012/05/about-sanjay-dutt-biography.html|publisher=movies.addatoday.com|accessdate=2013-08-22|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131113015447/http://movies.addatoday.com/2012/05/about-sanjay-dutt-biography.html|archive-date=13 November 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=Sanjay rece|url=http://movies.addatoday.com/2012/05/about-sanjay-dutt-biography.html|publisher=movies.addatoday.com|accessdate=2013-08-22|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131113015447/http://movies.addatoday.com/2012/05/about-sanjay-dutt-biography.html|archive-date=13 November 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} In the late 1980s he was seen in a number of multi-starrers alongside actors like [[Govinda]], [[Mithun Chakraborty|Mithun]], [[Dharmendra]], [[Jackie Shroff]] and [[Sunny Deol]]. His successes continued in the 1990s, with films that include ''[[Tejaa]]'', ''[[Khatarnaak]]'', ''[[Zahreelay]]'', ''[[Thanedaar]]'', ''[[Khoon Ka Karz]]'', ''[[Yalgaar (India film)|Yalgaar]]'', ''[[Gumrah (1993 film)|Gumrah]]'', ''[[Sahibaan]]'', and ''[[Aatish: Feel the Fire]]''. He went on to star in some of the most era-defining Indian films of the early 1990s such as ''[[Sadak]]'', ''[[Saajan]]'' (for which he was nominated for the [[Filmfare Best Actor Award]]) and ''[[Khal Nayak]]'', for which he earned his second Filmfare Best Actor Award nominationhttps://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-others/sanjay-dutt-on-the-wrong-side-of-the-law/. ''[[The Hindu]]'' wrote that ''"Sanjay's earlier films (like Naam and Sadak) got him a lot of favourable attention."'' and "Saajan'' established Sanjay Dutt as the conventional soft hero."''https://www.thehindu.com/thehindu/2000/12/08/stories/09080221.htm''[[Saajan]]'' was the highest-grossing [[Bollywood films of 1991#Highest grossing|Bollywood film of 1991]], and [[Sadak]] was the sixth highest grosser of 1991.https://web.archive.org/web/20130115230117/http://boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat=197&catName=MTk5MQ== ''[[Khal Nayak]]'' was a box office success. The movie was the second highest grosser of 1993.https://web.archive.org/web/20131017072516/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat=199&catName=MTk5Mw%3D%3D This was followed by another box office success [[Gumrah (1993 film)]], this was Dutt's second consecutive hit of the yearhttps://tribune.com.pk/story/1054253/10-movies-we-couldnt-imagine-without-sanju-baba/. ===1997–present=== Dutt's first film after his 1993 arrest was ''[[Daud (film)|Daud]]'' (1997). It did not do well at the box office.{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficeindia.com/years.php?year=1997&pageId=4|title=Top India Total Nett Gross 1997 - - Box Office India|website=www.boxofficeindia.com}} He followed this with the 1998 ''[[Dushman (1998 film)|Dushman]]'' which did not do well at the box office either.{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficeindia.com/years.php?year=1998&pageId=4|title=Top India Total Nett Gross 1998 - - Box Office India|website=www.boxofficeindia.com}} 1999 was an excellent year for Dutt and one that is regarded as his comeback, with all of his five releases being amongst the highest-grossing films of that year. He began it by starring in the Mahesh Bhatt-directed hit ''[[Kartoos]]'', followed by ''[[Khoobsurat (1999 film)|Khoobsurat]]'', ''[[Haseena Maan Jaayegi]]'', ''[[Daag: The Fire]]'' and ''[[Vaastav: The Reality]]'', for which he won many awards, including his first Filmfare Best Actor Award.{{cite web|url=https://www.msn.com/en-in/entertainment/bollywood/sanjay-dutt-turns-57/ss-BBpUr2p|title=Sanjay Dutt turns 57|website=www.msn.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.timesnownews.com/entertainment/news/bollywood-news/article/sanjay-dutt-feels-his-cult-film-vaastav-wasn-t-good-did-you-notice-this-fact-in-sanju/250526|title=Sanjay Dutt feels his cult film Vaastav wasn’t good - did you notice this fact in Sanju?|publisher=}} His role in 2000's ''[[Mission Kashmir]]'' won him critical acclaim and a number of awards and nominations.https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-others/sanjay-dutt-on-the-wrong-side-of-the-law/ Dutt was also invited by the President of India to [[Rashtrapati Bhavan]] for his performance in the movie.{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=yFAvxLLVPygC&pg=PA461&lpg=PA461&dq=just+couldn’t+believe+what+was+happening+around+me.+I+was+in+a+haze.+I+was+in+a+state+of+delirium.+I+couldn’t+for+the+life+of+me+believe+that+I+who+was+considered+and+is+still+considered+a+criminal#v=onepage&q=just%20couldn’t%20believe%20what%20was%20happening%20around%20me.%20I%20was%20in%20a%20haze.%20I%20was%20in%20a%20state%20of%20delirium.%20I%20couldn’t%20for%20the%20life%20of%20me%20believe%20that%20I%20who%20was%20considered%20and%20is%20still%20considered%20a%20criminal&f=false|title=Maximum city: Bombay lost and found|isbn=9780144001590|last1=Mehta|first1=Suketu|year=2006}} As the decade went on, he continued to play lead roles in popular and critical successes such as ''[[Jodi No.1]]'' (2001), ''[[Pitaah]]'' (2002), ''[[Kaante]]'' (2002) and the National Award-winning blockbuster ''[[Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.]]'' (2003), which garnered him several awards.https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/entertainment-others/sanjay-dutt-on-the-wrong-side-of-the-law/ At the box office ''[[Munna Bhai M.B.B.S.]]'' achieved a silver jubilee status (25-week run) being one of only eight films to have achieved this status since the year 2000. In its 26th week of release, the film could still be found playing on 257 screens throughout India.{{cite web|author=|title=Top Earners 2003|url=http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat=209&catName=MjAwMw==|publisher=boxofficeindia.com|accessdate=10 July 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120525225820/http://www.boxofficeindia.com/showProd.php?itemCat=209&catName=MjAwMw==|archivedate=25 May 2012|df=dmy-all}} Later successes came with ''[[Musafir (2004 film)|Musafir]]'' (2004), ''[[Plan]]'' (2004), ''[[Parineeta (2005 film)|Parineeta]]'' (2005) and ''[[Dus]]'' (2005). He won critical acclaim for his performances in ''[[Shabd (film)|Shabd]]'' (2005) and ''[[Zinda (film)|Zinda]]''. The blockbuster sequel of ''[[Munna Bhai M.B.B.S]]'', ''[[Lage Raho Munna Bhai]]'' was released in late 2006. Dutt received a number of awards for his performance in the film, along with an award from the Prime Minister [[Manmohan Singh]] for his work in the ''Munna bhai'' series.{{cite web|title=Sanjay Received award by PM|url=http://www.in.com/sanjay-dutt/biography-284.html|publisher=www.in.com|accessdate=2013-08-22}} [[NDTV India]] counted the character ''[[Munna Bhai]]'' as one of top 20 fictional characters in Bollywood.[http://movies.ndtv.com/photos/indian-cinema-100-bollywood-s-20-best-characters-15056/slide/3 Indian cinema@100: Bollywood's 20 best characters - NDTV]. [[NDTV]]. Retrieved July 14, 2014 Later Dutt starred in movies like ''[[Dhamaal]]'' (2007), ''[[Shootout at Lokhandwala]]'' (2007), ''[[All the Best: Fun Begins|All the Best]]'' (2009), ''[[Double Dhamaal]]'' (2011), ''[[Son of Sardaar]]'' (2012) ''[[Agneepath (2012 film)|Agneepath]]'' (2012) and ''[[PK (film)|PK]]''. In January 2008, the Indian film Institute Filmfare listed 12 films featuring Dutt in its top 100 highest-grossing movies of all-time list. In its May 2013 edition 100 years of Indian cinema Filmfare listed three films featuring Dutt in its top 20 list of highest-grossing Hindi films of all time, adjusted for inflation these films were ''Lage Raho Munna Bhai'', ''Khalnayak'' and ''Saajan''.{{cite web|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/299794|title=#4 Key Turning Points in the Career of Bollywood's favourite Baba|first=Nidhi|last=Singh|date=7 September 2017|publisher=}} Vidhu Vinod Chopra on 29 September 2016 announced that the third Munna Bhai film, starring Dutt in the title role, would begin soon.{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/work-on-munnabhai-3-to-begin-next-year-vidhu-vinod-chopra/1/776723.html|title=Work on Munnabhai 3 to begin next year: Vidhu Vinod Chopra|website=India Today}} In 2017, Dutt appeared as the lead in ''[[Bhoomi (film)|Bhoomi]]'', directed by [[Omung Kumar]]https://www.thehindu.com/features/cinema/Omung-Kumar%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%98Bhoomi%E2%80%99-to-be-Sanjay-Dutt%E2%80%99s-comeback-film/article16668989.ece#!. In 2018 he starred in ''Saheb, Biwi Aur Gangster 3''.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/movies-to-look-forward-to/sd/photostory/58803816.cms|title=Pic: Sanjay Dutt’s new look for ‘Saheb Biwi Aur Gangster 3’ is menacing - Movies to look forward to {{!}} The Times of India|website=The Times of India|access-date=2017-09-28}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/saheb-biwi-aur-gangster-3-sanjay-dutt-chitrangada-singh-begin-shooting-in-rajasthan/story-u91f4APbiAYtFzwYOaKjeK.html|title=Saheb Biwi Aur Gangster 3: Sanjay Dutt, Chitrangada Singh begin shooting in Rajasthan|date=2017-09-28|work=hindustantimes.com|access-date=2017-09-28|language=en}} On June 29 2018, his biopic ''[[Sanju]]'' released in which he made a special appearance.https://www.thequint.com/entertainment/bollywood/sanjay-dutt-stars-in-sanju ==Other activities== ===Bigg Boss 5=== Dutt co-hosted the [[Bigg Boss 5|fifth season]] of the Indian reality show ''[[Bigg Boss]]'' along with [[Salman Khan]]. The show aired on ''Colors'' television from 2 October 2011 to 7 January 2012.{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt, Salman to host Bigg Boss 5 together|url=http://www.mid-day.com/entertainment/2011/jul/200711-informer-2.htm|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=Mi Day}} Dutt later said it was Khan who persuaded him to co-host the show.{{cite news|title=Salman convinced me for Bigg Boss: Sanjay Dutt|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Television/Salman-convinced-me-for-Bigg-Boss-Sanjay-Dutt/Article1-752439.aspx|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=Hindustan Times|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120106030402/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Television/salman-convinced-me-for-bigg-boss-sanjay-dutt/Article1-752439.aspx|archivedate=6 January 2012|df=dmy-all}} ===Super Fight League=== Dutt and entrepreneur [[Indian Premier League]]-cricket team owner [[Raj Kundra]] together launched India's first professionally- organised [[mixed martial arts]] league — the [[Super Fight League]] — on 16 January 2012.{{cite news |title=Ready for the Super Fight League? |newspaper=The Times Of India |location=Mumbai |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-01-17/news-interviews/30632385_1_mma-sport-fight-night|first=Roshni |last=Olivera |accessdate=2012-01-19}} ==Controversies== ===1993–2006=== Bombay (now Mumbai) suffered a series of [[1993 Bombay bombings|serial bombings in 1993]]. Dutt was among several people associated with Bollywood who were accused of involvement. It was alleged that Dutt accepted a delivery of weapons at his house from [[Abu Salem]] and co-accused Riyaz Siddiqui, who had also been implicated in relation to the Mumbai blasts.{{cite news |url=http://cities.expressindia.com/fullstory.php?newsid=174294 |title=Charges framed against Salem|publisher=Indian Express|accessdate=2009-04-19|date=18 March 2006 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090829173254/http://cities.expressindia.com/fullstory.php?newsid=174294 |archivedate=29 August 2009}} It was claimed that the weapons formed a part of a large consignment of arms connected to the terrorists. Dutt however in his confession stated that he took only one AK-56 from the producers of his movie Sanam, for his own family protection.{{cite web|url=https://www.news18.com/news/india/1993-mumbai-blasts-sanjay-dutts-confessional-statement-598327.html|title=1993 Mumbai blasts: Sanjay Dutt's confessional statement|publisher=}} It has also been reported that Sanjay Dutt's father [[Sunil Dutt]]'s political rivalry caused Sanjay Dutt's conviction.https://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/reel-vs-real-the-politics-behind-the-life-and-crimes-of-sanjay-dutt-118070900115_1.html In April 1993, he was arrested under the provisions of the [[Terrorist and Disruptive Activities (Prevention) Act]] (TADA).{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/sanjay-dutt-gets-6-yrs-jail-taken-into-custody/45923-4-single.html|title=Sanjay Dutt gets 6 yrs jail, taken into custody |publisher=IBN |accessdate=2009-04-19 |date=31 July 2007|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091219154300/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/sanjay-dutt-gets-6-yrs-jail-taken-into-custody/45923-4-single.html|archivedate=19 Dec 2009}}{{cite book|author=Ryan Clarke |title=Crime-Terror Nexus in South Asia: States, Security and Non-State Actors |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=IQcbIfg739IC&pg=PA58|accessdate=2013-05-16|date=12 April 2011 |publisher=Taylor & Francis|isbn=978-1-136-73970-5|pages=58–}}{{cite web |url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/sanjay-dutt-gets-fiveyear-jail-term-in-1993-mumbai-blasts/1091259/ |title=Sanjay Dutt sentenced to 5 years in jail, gets 4 weeks to surrender |publisher=Indian Express |date=2013-03-22 |accessdate=2013-04-01}} Dutt was granted bail by the [[Supreme Court of India]] on 5th May 1993, however on July 4th 1994 his bail was cancelled and he was re-arrested. On October 16 1995 he was granted bail.{{cite web|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/india/from-arrest-to-release-a-complete-23-year-long-sanjay-dutt-timeline/story-7lEBOzaghF8UDsUiwBLKyO.html|title=From arrest to release: A complete, 23-year-long Sanjay Dutt timeline|date=25 February 2016|publisher=}} ===2007–2009=== Abdul Qayyum Abdul Karim Shaikh, who was thought to be a close aide of the terrorists' ringleader, [[Dawood Ibrahim]], was arrested.{{cite web|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/man-who-supplied-pistol-to-sanjay-dutt-arrested/23273/|title=Man who supplied pistol to Sanjay Dutt arrested|publisher=Indian Express|accessdate=2009-04-19|date=14 February 2007}} Dutt had given Qayuum's name to the police when confessing to arms possession, saying that in September 1992 he had bought a [[pistol]] from Qayuum in [[Dubai]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/news/2007/feb/13shaikh.htm|title=93 blast accused Abdul Qayyum Shaikh arrested|publisher=[[rediff.com]]|accessdate=2009-04-19|date=13 February 2007}} On 31 July 2007, Dutt was cleared of the charges relating to the Mumbai Blast, however the TADA court sentenced Dutt to six years' [[rigorous imprisonment]] under Arms' act for illegal possession of weapons.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2007/aug/01/film.india|title=Bollywood star gets six years as lengthy Mumbai bombing trial ends|author=Randeep Ramesh|work=the Guardian|accessdate=2015-08-21}} According to ''[[The Guardian]]'', "The actor claimed he feared for his life after the notorious 'Black Friday' bombings, which were allegedly staged by Mumbai's Muslim-dominated mafia in retaliation for deadly Hindu-Muslim clashes a few months earlier. But the judge rejected this defence and also refused bail." Dutt was returned to jail at Arthur Road and soon after moved to the [[Yerwada Central Jail]] in [[Pune]].{{cite news | url = http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/story.aspx?id=NEWEN20070021271 | title = Priya to approach SC for Sanju's bail | author = Imtiaz Jaleel | publisher = NDTV | date = 2 August 2007 | accessdate = 2007-07-31 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20070926225512/http://www.ndtv.com/convergence/ndtv/story.aspx?id=NEWEN20070021271 | archivedate = 26 September 2007 | df = dmy-all }} Dutt appealed against the sentence{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/6934560.stm|title=BBC NEWS - South Asia - Bollywood's Dutt appeals sentence|work=bbc.co.uk|accessdate=2015-08-21}} and was granted interim bail on 20 August 2007 until such time as the TADA court provided him with a copy of its judgement.[http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2007/08/20/9955/index.html Sanjay Dutt gets bail. He was biif] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090829180603/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/news/2007/08/20/9955/index.html |date=29 August 2009 }} On 22 October 2007 Dutt was back in jail but again applied for bail. On 27 November 2007, Dutt was granted bail by the Supreme Court.{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/articleshow/2580913.cms|title=Sanjay Dutt released from Pune jail|work=The Times of India|accessdate=2015-08-21}} On 21 March 2013 the Supreme Court upheld the verdict of the TADA court but shortened the sentence to five years' imprisonment. Dutt was given a month to surrender before the authorities.{{cite news|title=As it happened: I’ve been a good human, says Sanjay Dutt|url=http://www.firstpost.com/india/as-it-happened-ive-been-a-good-human-says-sanjay-dutt-669614.html|accessdate=2013-05-17|newspaper=First Post|date=21 March 2013}} Dutt has said that "I am not a politician but I belong to a political family."{{cite news |url=http://in.reuters.com/article/topNews/idINIndia-37493320090116?sp=true |title=Sanjay Dutt to contest elections on Samajwadi Party ticket |publisher=Reuters |date=16 January 2009}} He was persuaded by a close friend to contest the 2009 [[Indian general election, 2009|Lok Sabha elections]] as a candidate for the [[Samajwadi Party]] but withdrew when the court refused to suspend his conviction.{{cite news |url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/sanjay-dutt-cant-contest-polls-supreme-court/89121-37.html |title=Sanjay Dutt can't contest polls: Supreme Court |publisher=IBN |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121016032036/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/sanjay-dutt-cant-contest-polls-supreme-court/89121-37.html |archivedate=16 October 2012 |date=31 March 2009}} He was then appointed General Secretary of the party, leaving that post in December 2010.{{cite web|title=Sanjay Dutt leaves the post of Samajwadi Party|url=http://in.news.yahoo.com/sanjay-dutt-s-20-year-nightmare-094611351.html|publisher=yahoo|accessdate=2013-08-22}} ===Re-imprisonment and release=== In March 2013 the Supreme Court upheld Dutt's five-year sentence, 18 months of which he already spent in jail during the trial.{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/sanjay-dutt-convicted-in-1993-bombay-blasts-case-gets-5-years-in-jail-345095?pfrom=home-lateststories |title=Sanjay Dutt convicted in 1993 Bombay blasts case, gets 5 years in jail |publisher=NDTV.com |date=2013-03-21 |accessdate=2013-04-01}} He was given four weeks to surrender to the authorities, the court having refused to release him on probation due to the severity of the offence.{{cite web|title=Sanjay Dutt given 4 Weeks to surrender |url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/news/sc-grants-4-weeks-more-to-Sanjay-Dutt-to-surrender/article4627135.ece|publisher=hindubusinessline.com|accessdate=2013-08-22}} With analysts believing that his imprisonment would have a significant impact on the fortunes of Bollywood, people from the movie business made statements of support following the ruling and some said that they would be making appeals for him to be pardoned.{{cite web|author=AP |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Will-meet-governor-of-Maharashtra-and-plead-for-Sanjay-Dutt-Jaya-Bachchan/articleshow/19126008.cms |title=Will meet governor of Maharashtra and plead for Sanjay Dutt: Jaya Bachchan |publisher=The Times of India |date=2013-03-22 |accessdate=2013-04-01}}{{cite web|url=http://daily.bhaskar.com/article/MAH-MUM-pardon-sanjay-dutt-katju-appeals-to-maharashtra-governor-4214575-NOR.html |title=Pardon Sanjay Dutt: Katju appeals to Maharashtra Governor |publisher=daily.bhaskar.com |date=2013-03-21 |accessdate=2013-04-01}} On 10 May, the Supreme Court rejected Dutt's [[review petition]] for the reconsideration of his conviction and asked him to surrender on the stipulated date.{{cite news |title=1993 Mumbai blasts case: 1993 Bombay blast case: Supreme Court dismisses Sanjay Dutt's review petition|newspaper=Economic Times |location=Mumbai |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/politics-and-nation/1993-bombay-blast-case-supreme-court-dismisses-sanjay-dutts-review-petition/articleshow/19986334.cms}}{{cite web|title=Review plea rejected: Sanjay Dutt will have to go to Jail|url=http://southmonitor.com/2013/05/11/review-plea-rejected-sanjay-dutt-will-have-to-go-to-jail/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150909031023/http://southmonitor.com/2013/05/11/review-plea-rejected-sanjay-dutt-will-have-to-go-to-jail/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2015-09-09|publisher=Southmonitor.com}} On 13 May, the Supreme Court rejected appeals filed by two film producers who were seeking more time for the actor to surrender so that he could complete two of his under-production films.{{cite news |title=Sanjay Dutt will not be given more time to surrender: Supreme Court|newspaper=NDTV|location=New Delhi|url=http://www.ndtv.com/article/india/sanjay-dutt-will-not-be-given-more-time-to-surrender-supreme-court-366653}} On 14 May, Dutt withdrew the mercy plea and surrendered to the Mumbai Police on 16 May 2013.{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt withdraws plea, set to surrender before TADA court tomorrow/1116049/?rheditorpick#sthash.mToe0p5t.dpuf|url=http://www.indianexpress.com/news/sanjay-dutt-withdraws-plea-set-to-surrender-before-jail-tomorrow/1116049/?rheditorpick|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=Indian Express|date=16 May 2013}}{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt reaches Tada court, will surrender shortly|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-05-16/india/39309264_1_imperial-heights-sanjay-dutt-manyata|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=The Times of India|date=16 May 2013}} Just before the surrender, the Mumbai jail authority got an anonymous letter threatening Dutt's life. Dutt filed an appeal to allow him to surrender before entering Yerwada Central Jail. Later, Dutt withdrew this request too.{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt to surrender today, jail gets threat letter|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-05-16/india/39309404_1_sanjay-dutt-yerwada-jail-letter-threat|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=The Times of India}} Dutt subsequently surrendered in court as ordered.{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt surrenders before TADA court|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/sanjay-dutt-surrenders-before-tada-court/article4720603.ece|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=The Hindu|date=16 May 2013}}{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt surrenders before TADA court in Mumbai|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/Mumbai/Sanjay-Dutt-surrenders-before-TADA-court-in-Mumbai/Article1-1060977.aspx|accessdate=2013-05-16|newspaper=Hindustan Times|date=16 May 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130522160458/http://www.hindustantimes.com/India-news/mumbai/Sanjay-Dutt-surrenders-before-TADA-court-in-Mumbai/Article1-1060977.aspx|archivedate=22 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} He was paroled from 21 December 2013. The parole was extended three times until March 2014, raising concern in Bombay High Court and a proposal from the [[Government of Maharashtra]] to amend the law of parole. He returned to Yerwada Central Jail after his parole ended.{{cite news|title=Sanjay Dutt's parole over, leaves for Yerwada. In December 2014, he was out on Furlough for 14 days again.|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/sanjay-dutt-leaves-home-yerwada-jail/1/350688.html|newspaper=India Today|date=22 March 2014|accessdate=2014-05-28}} Dutt was out on a two weeks' furlough granted by the Yerwada Central Jail authorities on 24 December.{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/out-on-parole-sanjay-dutt-watches-pk-with-family-718105|title=Out on Parole, Sanjay Dutt Watches PK With Family|work=NDTVMovies.com|accessdate=2015-08-21}} He said "I have lost 18kg. Now if I lose any more weight, I will vanish."{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/sanjay-dutt-returns-home-says-hes-lost-18-kg/|title=Sanjay Dutt returns home, says he’s lost 18 kg|date=24 December 2014|work=The Indian Express|accessdate=2015-08-21}} Sanjay Dutt was subsequently incarcerated in Yerwada Central Jail, to complete his jail term.{{cite web|url=http://www.ndtv.com/india-news/sanjay-dutt-shifted-to-punes-yerawada-jail-522972|title=Sanjay Dutt shifted to Pune's Yerawada Jail|author=Rashmi Rajput|date=22 May 2013|work=NDTV.com|accessdate=2015-08-21}} He was released from there on 25 February 2016 after serving his sentence.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-35647886|title=How Bollywood star Sanjay Dutt spent his time in jail|work=BBC News}} ==In popular culture== A biopic film titled [[Sanju]] based on the life of Dutt, in which [[Ranbir Kapoor]] portrays the title character,{{cite news |work=Indian Express|title=Shooting for Sanjay Dutt biopic featuring Ranbir Kapoor begins, tweets Rajkummar Hirani |date=14 January 2017 |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/bollywood/shooting-for-sanjay-dutt-biopic-begins-4473777/ |accessdate=2017-09-20}} was released worldwide on 29 June 2018. {{Cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/sanju-trailer-watch-drama-drugs-and-ranbir-kapoor/article24034889.ece|title=‘Sanju’ trailer watch: drama, drugs and Ranbir Kapoor|last=Desk|first=The Hindu Net|date=2018-05-30|work=The Hindu|access-date=2018-05-30|language=en-IN|issn=0971-751X}}{{Cite news|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/sanju-trailer-heres-how-bollywood-is-applauding-ranbir-kapoor-for-his-performance/articleshow/64383711.cms|title=Sanju Trailer: Here's how Bollywood is applauding Ranbir Kapoor for his performance - Times of India ►|work=The Times of India|access-date=2018-05-30}} ==Filmography== {{Main|Sanjay Dutt filmography}} ==Awards and nominations== {{Infobox actor awards | name = Sanjay Dutt | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | awards = 17 | nominations = 10 }} ===[[Filmfare Awards]]=== * 1992: Nominated, [[Filmfare Best Actor Award|Best Actor]] for ''[[Saajan]]'' * 1994: Nominated, Best Actor for ''[[Khalnayak]]'' * 2000: Winner, Best Actor for ''[[Vaastav: The Reality]]'' * 2001: Nominated, Best Actor for ''[[Mission Kashmir]]'' * 2003: Nominated, [[Filmfare Best Supporting Actor Award|Best Supporting Actor]] for ''[[Kaante]]'' * 2004: Winner, [[Filmfare Best Comedian Award|Best Comedian]] for ''[[Munnabhai M.B.B.S.]]'' * 2006: Nominated, Best Supporting Actor for ''[[Parineeta (2005 film)|Parineeta]]'' * 2007: Nominated, Best Actor for ''[[Lage Raho Munna Bhai]]'' ===[[Star Screen Awards]]=== * 2000: Winner, [[Star Screen Award Best Actor|Best Actor]] for ''Vaastav: The Reality'' * 2001: Nominated, Best Actor for ''[[Kurukshetra]]'' * 2001: Winner, [[Star Screen Award Best Supporting Actor|Best Supporting Actor]] for ''Mission Kashmir'' * 2004: Nominated, Best Actor for ''Munnabhai M.B.B.S.'' * 2005: Nominated, Best Supporting Actor for ''[[Musafir (2004 film)|Musafir]]'' ===[[International Indian Film Academy Awards]]=== * 2000: Winner, [[IIFA Best Actor Award|Best Actor]] for ''Vaastav: The Reality'' * 2001: Nominated, Best Actor for ''Mission Kashmir'' * 2007: Nominated, Best Actor for ''Lage Raho Munna Bhai'' {{cite web|url=http://indiafm.com/features/2007/04/04/2478/index.html|title=Sanjay Dutt gets inspired by Steve Martin? - Bollywood Hungama|first=Bollywood|last=Hungama|date=26 July 2011|publisher=}} * 2010: Winner, [[IIFA Best Comedian Award|Best Performance in a Comic Role]] for ''[[All the Best: Fun Begins|All the Best]]''{{Cite web |url=http://filmicafe.com/news_detail.php?news_id=14876 |title=Archived copy |access-date=22 May 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120306113651/http://filmicafe.com/news_detail.php?news_id=14876 |archive-date=6 March 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} ===[[Global Indian Film Awards]]=== * 2006: Winner, [[Global Indian Film Awards]], Critics Choice Awards – Best Actor (Male) for ''Lage Raho Munna Bhai''{{cite news| first=| last=| url=http://www.mygifa.com/awards-category.html| title=2006 Global Indian Film Awards| publisher=mygifa.com| date=| accessdate=2006-12-10| deadurl=yes| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927233921/http://www.mygifa.com/awards-category.html| archivedate=27 September 2007| df=dmy-all}} ===[[Stardust Awards]]=== * 2004: Winner, [[Stardust Star of the Year Award - Male]], ''Munnabhai M.B.B.S.'' * 2007: Winner, Stardust Star of the Year Award - Male, ''Lage Raho Munna Bhai''{{cite web|url=http://indiafm.com/features/2007/02/19/2273/index.html|title=Check Out: Sameera Reddy doing some deadly stunts in Tezz - Bollywood Hungama|first=Bollywood|last=Hungama|date=1 June 2011|publisher=}} * 2013: Winner, Stardust Award for Best Actor in Negative Role, ''[[Agneepath (2012 film)|Agneepath]]''{{cite web|url=http://movies.ndtv.com/bollywood/stardust-awards-2013-list-of-winners-322721|title=NDTV Movies|work=ndtv.com|accessdate=2015-08-21}} ===[[Zee Cine Awards]]=== * 2001: Winner, [[Zee Premiere Choice- Male]] for ''Mission Kashmir'' * 2007: Winner, [[Zee Cine Awards]] – Best Actor (Male) Critics Awards for ''Lage Raho Munna Bhai''[http://indiafm.com/features/2007/04/01/2465/index.html Winners of the Zee Cine Awards 2007] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090524075741/http://www.bollywoodhungama.com/features/2007/04/01/2465/index.html |date=24 May 2009 }} ===[[Bollywood Movie Awards]]=== * 2003: Winner, [[Bollywood Movie Award - Critics Award Male]] for ''Kaante'' * 2004: Winner, [[Bollywood Movie Award - Most Sensational Actor]] for ''Munnabhai M.B.B.S.'' ===[[Bengal Film Journalists' Association Awards]]=== * 2004: Winner, [[Bengal Film Journalists' Association - Best Actor Award (Hindi)|BFJA Awards, Best Actor]] for ''Munnabhai M.B.B.S.'' [http://www.bfjaawards.com/awards/winlist/winlist04.htm 67th Annual BFJA Awards] ===Other awards=== * 2004: Winner, Celebrity Style Male at the Bollywood Fashion Awards ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Library resources box|viaf=64240660}} {{commons category}} * {{IMDb name|id=00004569}} * {{Twitter}} {{Navboxes | title = Awards for Sanjay Dutt | list = {{FilmfareAwardBestActor 1981-2000}} {{FilmfareAwardBestComedian}} {{ScreenAwardBestActor}} {{ScreenAwardBestSupportingActor}} {{StardustAwardMaleStar}} {{ZeeCineAwardBestActorMale}} }} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2016}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dutt, Sanjay}} [[Category:1959 births]] [[Category:Male actors in Hindi cinema]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Filmfare Awards winners]] [[Category:Indian male child actors]] [[Category:Indian male singers]] [[Category:Lawrence School, Sanawar alumni]] [[Category:Politicians from Mumbai]] [[Category:Samajwadi Party politicians]] [[Category:Male actors from Mumbai]] [[Category:Film producers from Mumbai]] [[Category:Indian actor-politicians]] [[Category:Bigg Boss]] [[Category:Indian game show hosts]] [[Category:Paroled people]] [[Category:Punjabi people]] [[Category:20th-century Indian male actors]] [[Category:21st-century Indian male actors]] [[Category:Indian male comedians]] [[Category:Hindi film producers]] [[Category:Indian criminals]]
